title: Qualcomm Earnings Outlook Dented by Smartphone Demand Woes; Mobile-phone chip producer offers cool forecast amid softening consumer demand
text:
Qualcomm's earnings-per-share forecast for the current quarter was impacted by macroeconomic weakness and the slowdown in smartphone sales, the company said, although it still expects an increase from the prior year.

The handset slowdown has been most pronounced for cheaper models, Qualcomm Chief Executive Cristiano Amon said in an interview. Qualcomm's chips, which power apps and handle communications with cell towers, skew toward higher-end phones—including those made by Samsung Electronics Co. and Apple Inc.—where the market has been more resilient, he said.

Qualcomm said revenues from chips for handsets climbed by 59% to $6.15 billion in its latest quarter, but they fell sequentially from a high of $6.33 billion in the previous period.

Write to Asa Fitch at asa.fitch@wsj.com

Qualcomm Earnings Outlook Dented by Smartphone Demand Woes
